meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting a system of planetary motion in which a planet moves in an orbit around the earth while the center of the orbit moves around the earth in a larger circle.
meanings.sent1: The epicyclic movement of the planet fascinated the astronomers.
meanings.sent2: The epicyclic path of the moon around the earth is intriguing.
meanings.sent3: The epicyclic dance of the planets around the sun was like a cosmic waltz.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts followed an epicyclic pattern, circling back to the same ideas.
meanings.sent5: The epicyclic nature of the solar system made for a captivating study.

meanings.definition: A gear system in which one or more gears rotate within a larger gear.
meanings.sent1: The bicycle's epicyclic gear system allowed for smooth pedaling.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic explained how the epicyclic gears function in the car's transmission.
meanings.sent3: The epicyclic gear set in the clock made the ticking sound rhythmic and soothing.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like an epicyclic gear, turning thoughts within thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The epicyclic gear arrangement in the engine optimized power distribution.
